explanation: Agent A is correct. The expression-statement "(void) req_cls;" is an executed no-op: it produces no side-effects and removing it would not change the program’s runtime behaviour. Per the rule text (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), that meets the definition of dead code. (The common rationale for such casts — to suppress compiler warnings about unused parameters — affects diagnostics only, not program behaviour, and so does not avoid the rule.)
